sentences.english: The thesis advocates that such an idea is wrong on grounds of sufficient and confidencial historical materials.
sentences.chinese: 本文在詳實的資料基礎上指出，這一看法是錯誤的。

sentences.english: He is good at writing, drawing and giving lessons. he would analysis a feedback system quite informatively, from the principle to the application.
sentences.chinese: 一個反饋系統，他從原理到應用，分析得相當詳實。

sentences.english: In love, the data is even clearer.
sentences.chinese: 對於愛情而言，資料更爲詳實。

sentences.english: Informative and powerful evidence to safeguard the interests of the parties to provide effective protection.
sentences.chinese: 詳實而有力的證據爲維護當事人利益切實提供了保障。

sentences.english: And, it offers rich research resource for DOT construction in future.
sentences.chinese: 爲今後的雙圓隧道建設提供了詳實的研究基礎。

sentences.english: On time reporting of day-to-day business activities and commodity information.
sentences.chinese: 商業及品牌活動信息，豐富詳實。

definition: thorough and detailed/exhaustive/the tedious details in full
to do textual research/to make textual criticism/to verify by means of research (esp. historical details)/to take an exam to get a certificate (abbr. for 考取證件|考取证件[kao3 qu3 zheng4 jian4])
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
to prove a point/to expound on/to demonstrate or prove (through argument)/proof
direct observation/directly perceived through the senses/intuitive/audiovisual
lit. looking for a fine horse using only a picture (idiom)/fig. to do things along rigid, conventional lines/to try and find sth with the help of a clue
